content:
Diagnosis:	Malignant melanoma right upper arm
	Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy March 2024
	pT2aN0M0, Breslow 2.1mm, no ulceration, no lymphovascular invasion
	BRAF and NRAS wild type

I reviewed [redacted name] today in the melanoma surveillance clinic. She has recovered well from her surgery with good wound healing. The surgical scar on the right upper arm is well-healed with no concerning features. There is no palpable lymphadenopathy in the right axilla. No new skin lesions identified on full skin examination today.

Her latest chest x-ray from 15/4/24 shows no evidence of metastatic disease. Blood tests including LDH remain within normal range.

I have provided education regarding sun protection and skin self-examination. She will continue with 3-monthly surveillance visits for the first year. I have arranged follow-up in the melanoma clinic in 3 months with repeat blood tests including LDH. She understands to contact us sooner if she develops any new concerning symptoms or skin changes.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Melanoma, Breslow 2.1mm, no ulceration, no lymphovascular invasion

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
Chest x-ray shows no evidence of metastatic disease

patient_facts.value: Well-healed surgical scar on right upper arm with no concerning features
No palpable lymphadenopathy in right axilla
No new skin lesions on full skin examination

status_updates.value: Stage IIA melanoma post wide local excision and SLNB. Currently well with no evidence of recurrence.
Repeat blood tests including LDH in 3 months
Follow-up in melanoma clinic in 3 months
